**Iskenderun's Battlesphere** is a level 5 [Conjurations](/Conjurations "Conjurations") spell which conjures a friendly [battlesphere](/Battlesphere "Battlesphere") to support your magical attacks.

## Contents

- [1 Useful Info](#Useful_Info)
- [2 Strategy](#Strategy)
- [3 Monster Version](#Monster_Version)
- [4 History](#History)

## Useful Info

Each time you cast a [destructive spell](/Destructive_spell "Destructive spell"), the battlesphere will shoot a perfectly accurate, irresistible beam. It is aimed at a random target within its line of fire. The battlesphere cannot fire through you. However, you can fire through the battlesphere.

> Damage formula: 2d(6 + Power/11)  
> Number of charges: 4 + (1d(Power + 10)-1)/10  
> Max. spellpower: 100

Battlespheres have a limited amount of charges. It will dissipate when: it runs out of charges, you enter a different floor, if destroyed by enemy attacks, or if it times out.

You may only create one battlesphere at a time. Casting it while one already exists will recall it to your location and increase both its duration and number of charges (max 20). Battlespheres are not considered [summons](/Summon "Summon"), and are not blocked by [Okawaru](/Okawaru "Okawaru") or [Ru](/Ru "Ru")'s Sacrifice Love.

"Destructive spells" are spells that [Vehumet](/Vehumet "Vehumet") supports. For a full list of eligible spells, see [destructive spell](/Destructive_spell "Destructive spell"). The only destructive spells that battlespheres won't support are Iskenderun's Battlesphere (obviously) and [Spellforged Servitor](/Spellforged_Servitor "Spellforged Servitor"). You can also view the list of eligible spells by looking at this spell's description.

The [unrand](/Unrand "Unrand") [sphere of Battle](/Sphere_of_Battle "Sphere of Battle") will create a battlesphere every time monsters are in sight.

## Strategy

Iskenderun's Battlesphere deals reasonable damage which never misses and cannot be resisted. It works best with low-level (low MP) spells like [Magic Dart](/Magic_Dart "Magic Dart"), [Poisonous Vapours](/Poisonous_Vapours "Poisonous Vapours"), and [Stone Arrow](/Stone_Arrow "Stone Arrow"), which let you "cast" Battlesphere beams at 1-3 MP. Fairly MP-efficient, and much quieter than the likes of [Fireball](/Fireball "Fireball") or [Plasma Beam](/Plasma_Beam "Plasma Beam").

It is best to summon a battlesphere before enemies are in sight. E.g. if you see a [sleeping](/Sleep "Sleep") monster, back away, create a battlesphere, then go in. When fighting a monster, you may want to (not always) turn a corner, create a battlesphere, and wait. This way, you are more turn efficient. Technically, it is optimal to constantly keep the battlesphere up during exploration.

You can fire through the battlesphere, however, monsters can't. With good pathing and a bit of luck, you can put the sphere between yourself and a nasty hexer / banisher / malmutator. Keep in mind that the battlesphere has the [maintain range](/Maintain_range "Maintain range") flag, so it will try to move away from monsters.

## Monster Version

Battlespheres created by monsters function identically to your own. The following enemies cast Iskenderun's Battlesphere:

- Q [![Tengu conjurer.png](/images/a/ac/Tengu_conjurer.png)](/File:Tengu_conjurer.png) **[Tengu conjurer](/Tengu_conjurer "Tengu conjurer")**

## History

- Prior to [0.30](/0.30 "0.30"), battlespheres would only trigger with [Conjurations](/Conjurations "Conjurations") spells.
- Prior to [0.26](/0.26 "0.26"), Iskenderun's Battlesphere was a [Conjurations](/Conjurations "Conjurations") / [Charms](/Charms "Charms") spell. It was aimed at the target you fired, rather than a random target. It didn't work with non-targetable Conjurations (like [Static Discharge](/Static_Discharge "Static Discharge")). However, it would trigger with certain non-Conjurations spells.
- Prior to [0.20](/0.20 "0.20"), this spell could be found in the [book of Conjurations](/Book_of_Conjurations "Book of Conjurations") instead of the [book of Power](/Book_of_Power "Book of Power").
- In [0.18](/0.18 "0.18"), The battlesphere supports mephitic cloud, and probably more spells also.
- Prior to [0.14](/0.14 "0.14"), this was a level 4 spell.
- Iskenderun's Battlesphere was added in [0.12](/0.12 "0.12").

 Iskenderun's Battlesphere
Level 5
School1 Conjuration
Source(s)
  • Book of Power
Casting noise 4
Spell noise 0
Conjures a small globe of magical energy. Each time its creator casts a destructive spell (other than Battlesphere itself or Spellforged Servitor), the battlesphere will launch its own volley of energy at a random foe. With increasing power, the battlesphere lasts longer and deals more damage per volley.

Iskenderun's Battlesphere is a level 5 Conjurations spell which conjures a friendly battlesphere to support your magical attacks.

Contents

  • 1 Useful Info
  • 2 Strategy
  • 3 Monster Version
  • 4 History

Useful Info

Damage formula: 2d(6 + Power/11)
Number of charges: 4 + (1d(Power + 10)-1)/10
Max. spellpower: 100

Battlespheres have a limited amount of charges. It will dissipate when: it runs out of charges, you enter a different floor, if destroyed by enemy attacks, or if it times out.

You may only create one battlesphere at a time. Casting it while one already exists will recall it to your location and increase both its duration and number of charges (max 20). Battlespheres are not considered summons, and are not blocked by Okawaru or Ru's Sacrifice Love.

"Destructive spells" are spells that Vehumet supports. For a full list of eligible spells, see destructive spell. The only destructive spells that battlespheres won't support are Iskenderun's Battlesphere (obviously) and Spellforged Servitor. You can also view the list of eligible spells by looking at this spell's description.

The unrand sphere of Battle will create a battlesphere every time monsters are in sight.

Strategy

Iskenderun's Battlesphere deals reasonable damage which never misses and cannot be resisted. It works best with low-level (low MP) spells like Magic Dart, Poisonous Vapours, and Stone Arrow, which let you "cast" Battlesphere beams at 1-3 MP. Fairly MP-efficient, and much quieter than the likes of Fireball or Plasma Beam.

When fighting a monster, you may want to (not always) turn a corner, create a battlesphere, and wait. This way, you are more turn efficient. Monster Version

Battlespheres created by monsters function identically to your own. The following enemies cast Iskenderun's Battlesphere:

  • Q Tengu conjurer

History

  • Prior to 0.30, battlespheres would only trigger with Conjurations spells.
  • Prior to 0.26, Iskenderun's Battlesphere was a Conjurations / Charms spell. It was aimed at the target you fired, rather than a random target. It didn't work with non-targetable Conjurations (like Static Discharge). However, it would trigger with certain non-Conjurations spells.
  • Prior to 0.20, this spell could be found in the book of Conjurations instead of the book of Power.
  • In 0.18, The battlesphere supports mephitic cloud, and probably more spells also.
  • Prior to 0.14, this was a level 4 spell.
